p: In terms of its secondary metabolites, A. quercifolia is not an extensively studied species. Studies involving methanolic or ethanolic extracts of the whole plant or the rhizome revealed the identification of several compounds [ 23, 24, 25]. Due to the use of polar solvents in the extraction, several reported compounds are polyphenolic, and others seemed not to be secondary metabolites. So, concerning the use of A. quercifolia in traditional medicine and nutrition, further studies focused on the plantâ€™s lipophilic constituents are needed to support its traditional use and possible medicinal properties.
